00029 from Koo.Rpc import RpcProxy
00030 from Koo import Rpc
00031 from Koo.Common.Settings import *

00044 ## @brief The RecordGroup class manages a list of records.
00045 # 
00046 # Provides functions for loading, storing and creating new objects of the same type.
00047 # The 'fields' property stores a dictionary of dictionaries, each of which contains 
00048 # information about a field. This information includes the data type ('type'), its name
00049 # ('name') and other attributes. The 'fieldObjects' property stores the classes responsible
00050 # for managing the values which are finally stored on the 'values' dictionary in the
00051 # Model
00052 #
00053 # The group can also be sorted by any of it's fields. Two sorting methods are provided:
00054 # SortVisibleItems and SortAllItems. SortVisibleItems is usually faster for a small
00055 # number of elements as sorting is handled on the client side, but only those loaded
00056 # are considered in the sorting. SortAllItems, sorts items in the server so all items
00057 # are considered. Although this would cost a lot when there are thousands of items, 
00058 # only some of them are loaded and the rest are loaded on demand.
00059 #
00060 # Note that by default the group will handle (and eventually load) all records that match 
00061 # the conditions imposed by 'domain' and 'filter'. Those are empty by default so creating 
00062 # RecordGroup('res.parnter') and iterating through it's items will return all partners
00063 # in the database. If you want to ensure that the group is kept completely empty, you can
00064 # call setAllowRecordLoading( False ) which is equivalent to calling setFilter() with a filter 
00065 # that no records match, but without the overhead of querying the server.
00066 #
00067 # RecordGroup will emit several kinds of signals on certain events. 
00068 class RecordGroup(QObject):
00069 
00070         SortVisibleItems = 1
00071         SortAllItems = 2
00072 
00073         SortingPossible = 0
00074         SortingNotPossible = 1
00075         SortingOnlyGroups = 2
00076         SortingNotPossibleModified = 3
00077 
00078         ## @brief Creates a new RecordGroup object.
00079         # @param resource Name of the model to load. Such as 'res.partner'.
00080         # @param fields Dictionary with the fields to load. This value typically comes from the server.
00081         # @param ids Record identifiers to load in the group.
00082         # @param parent Only used if this RecordGroup serves as a relation to another model. Otherwise it's None.
00083         # @param context Context for RPC calls.
00084         def __init__(self, resource, fields = None, ids=None, parent=None, context=None):
00085                 QObject.__init__(self)
00086                 if ids is None:
00087                         ids = []
00088                 if context is None:
00089                         context = {}
00090                 self.parent = parent
00091                 self._context = context
00092                 self._context.update(Rpc.session.context)
00093                 self.resource = resource
00094                 self.limit = Settings.value( 'limit', 80 )
00095                 self.maximumLimit = self.limit
00096                 self.rpc = RpcProxy(resource)
00097                 if fields == None:
00098                         self.fields = {}
00099                 else:
00100                         self.fields = fields
00101                 self.fieldObjects = {}
00102                 self.loadFieldObjects( self.fields.keys() )
00103 
00104                 self.records = []
00105 
00106                 self.enableSignals()
00107                 
00108                 # toBeSorted properties store information each time sort() function
00109                 # is called. If loading of records is not enabled, records won't be
00110                 # loaded but we keep by which field we want information to be sorted
00111                 # so when record loading is enabled again we know how should the sorting
00112                 # be.
00113                 self.toBeSortedField = None
00114                 self.toBeSortedOrder = None
00115 
00116                 self.sortedField = None
00117                 self.sortedOrder = None
00118                 self.updated = False
00119                 self._domain = []
00120                 self._filter = []
00121                 self._allowRecordLoading = True
00122 
00123                 if Settings.value('sort_mode') == 'visible_items':
00124                         self._sortMode = self.SortVisibleItems
00125                 else:
00126                         self._sortMode = self.SortAllItems
00127                 self._sortMode = self.SortAllItems
00128 
00129                 self.load(ids)
00130                 self.removedRecords = []
00131                 self._onWriteFunction = ''
00132 
00133         ## @brief Sets wether data loading should be done on record chunks or one by one.
00134         #
00135         # Setting value to True, will make the RecordGroup ignore the current 'limit' property,
00136         # and load records by one by, instead. If set to False (the default) it will load records
00137         # in groups of 'limit' (80, by default).
00138         #
00139         # In some cases (widgets that show multiple records) it's better to load in chunks, in other
00140         # cases, it's better to load one by one.
00141         def setLoadOneByOne(self, value):
00142                 if value:
00143                         self.limit = 1
00144                 else:
00145                         self.limit = self.maximumLimit
00146 
00147         def setSortMode(self, mode):
00148                 self._sortMode = mode
00149 
00150         def sortMode(self):
00151                 return self._sortMode
00152 
00153         def setOnWriteFunction(self, value):
00154                 self._onWriteFunction = value
00155 
00156         def onWriteFunction(self):
00157                 return self._onWriteFunction
00158 
00159         def __del__(self):
00160                 self.rpc = None
00161                 self.parent = None
00162                 self.resource = None
00163                 self._context = None
00164                 self.fields = None
00165                 for r in self.records:
00166                         if not isinstance(r, Record):
00167                                 continue
00168                         r.__del__()
00169                 self.records = []
00170                 for f in self.fieldObjects:
00171                         self.fieldObjects[f].parent = None
00172                         self.fieldObjects[f].setParent( None )
00173                         #self.disconnect( self.fieldObjects[f], None, 0, 0 )
00174                         #self.fieldObjects[f] = None
00175                         #del self.fieldObjects[f]
00176                 self.fieldObjects = {}
00177 
00178         ## @brief Returns a string with the name of the type of a given field. Such as 'char'.
00179         def fieldType( self, fieldName ):
00180                 if not fieldName in self.fields:
00181                         return None
00182                 return self.fields[fieldName]['type']
00183 
00184         # Creates the entries in 'fieldObjects' for each key of the 'fkeys' list.
00185         def loadFieldObjects(self, fkeys):
00186                 for fname in fkeys:
00187                         fvalue = self.fields[fname]
00188                         fvalue['name'] = fname
00189                         self.fieldObjects[fname] = Field.FieldFactory.create( fvalue['type'], self, fvalue )
00190                         if fvalue['type'] in ('binary','image'):
00191                                 self.fieldObjects['%s.size' % fname] = Field.FieldFactory.create( 'binary-size', self, fvalue )
00192 
00193         ## @brief Saves all the records. 
00194         #
00195         # Note that there will be one request to the server per modified or 
00196         # created record.
00197         def save(self):
00198                 for record in self.records:
00199                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00200                                 saved = record.save()
00201 
00202         ## @brief Returns a list with all modified records
00203         def modifiedRecords(self):
00204                 modified = []
00205                 for record in self.records:
00206                         if isinstance( record, Record ) and record.isModified():
00207                                 modified.append( record )
00208                 return modified
00209 
00210         ## @brief This function executes the 'onWriteFunction' function in the server.
00211         #
00212         # If there is a 'onWriteFunction' function associated with the model type handled by 
00213         # this record group it will be executed. 'editedId' should provide the 
00214         # id of the just saved record.
00215         #
00216         # This functionality is provided here instead of on the record because
00217         # the remote function might update some other records, and they need to
00218         # be (re)loaded.
00219         def written( self, editedId ):
00220                 if not self._onWriteFunction or not editedId:
00221                         return
00222                 # Execute the onWriteFunction function on the server.
00223                 # It's expected it'll return a list of ids to be loaded or reloaded.
00224                 new_ids = getattr(self.rpc, self._onWriteFunction)( editedId, self.context() )
00225                 record_idx = self.records.index( self.recordById( editedId ) )
00226                 result = False
00227                 indexes = []
00228                 for id in new_ids:
00229                         cont = False
00230                         for m in self.records:
00231                                 if isinstance( m, Record ):
00232                                         if m.id == id:
00233                                                 cont = True
00234                                                 # TODO: Shouldn't we just call cancel() so the record
00235                                                 # is reloaded on demand?
00236                                                 m.reload()
00237                         if cont:
00238                                 continue
00239                         # TODO: Should we reconsider this? Do we need/want to reload. Probably we
00240                         # only want to add the id to the list.
00241                         record = Record(id, self, parent=self.parent)
00242                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00243                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00244                         record.reload()
00245                         if not result:
00246                                 result = record
00247                         newIndex = min(record_idx, len(self.records)-1)
00248                         self.add(record, newIndex)
00249                         indexes.append(newIndex)
00250 
00251                 if indexes:
00252                         self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), min(indexes), max(indexes) )
00253                 return result
00254         
00255         ## @brief Adds a list of records as specified by 'values'.
00256         #
00257         # 'values' has to be a list of dictionaries, each of which containing fields
00258         # names -> values. At least key 'id' needs to be in all dictionaries.
00259         def loadFromValues(self, values):
00260                 start = len(self.records)
00261                 for value in values:
00262                         record = Record(value['id'], self, parent=self.parent)
00263                         record.set(value)
00264                         self.records.append(record)
00265                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00266                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00267                 end = len(self.records)-1
00268                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), start, end )
00269         
00270         ## @brief Creates as many records as len(ids) with the ids[x] as id.
00271         #
00272         # 'ids' needs to be a list of identifiers. The addFields() function
00273         # can be used later to load the necessary fields for each record.
00274         def load(self, ids, addOnTop=False):
00275                 if not ids:
00276                         return 
00277                 if addOnTop:
00278                         start = 0
00279                         # Discard from 'ids' those that are already loaded.
00280                         # If we didn't do that, some records could be repeated if the programmer
00281                         # doesn't verify that, and we'd end up in errors because when records are
00282                         # actually loaded they're only checked against a single appearance of the 
00283                         # id in the list of records.
00284                         #
00285                         # Note we don't use sets to discard ids, because we want to keep the order
00286                         # their order and because it can cause infinite recursion.
00287                         currentIds = self.ids()
00288                         for id in ids:
00289                                 if id not in currentIds:
00290                                         self.records.insert( 0, id )
00291                         end = len(ids)-1
00292                 else:
00293                         start = len(self.records)
00294                         # Discard from 'ids' those that are already loaded. Same as above.
00295                         currentIds = self.ids()
00296                         for id in ids:
00297                                 if id not in currentIds:
00298                                         self.records.append( id )
00299                         end = len(self.records)-1
00300                 # We consider the group is updated because otherwise calling count() would
00301                 # force an update() which would cause one2many relations to load elements
00302                 # when we only want to know how many are there.
00303                 self.updated = True
00304                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), start, end )
00305 
00306         ## @brief Clears the list of records. It doesn't remove them.
00307         def clear(self):
00308                 for record in self.records:
00309                         if isinstance(record, Record):
00310                                 self.disconnect( record, SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00311                                 self.disconnect( record, SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordModified )
00312                 last = len(self.records)-1
00313                 self.records = []
00314                 self.removedRecords = []
00315                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsRemoved(int,int)'), 0, last )
00316         
00317         ## @brief Returns a copy of the current context
00318         def context(self):
00319                 ctx = {}
00320                 ctx.update(self._context)
00321                 return ctx
00322 
00323         ## @brief Sets the context that will be used for RPC calls.
00324         def setContext(self, context):
00325                 self._context = context.copy()
00326 
00327         ## @brief Adds a record to the list
00328         def add(self, record, position=-1):
00329                 if not record.group is self:
00330                         fields = {}
00331                         for mf in record.group.fields:
00332                                 fields[record.group.fields[mf]['name']] = record.group.fields[mf]
00333                         self.addFields(fields)
00334                         record.group.addFields(self.fields)
00335                         record.group = self
00336 
00337                 if position==-1:
00338                         self.records.append(record)
00339                 else:
00340                         self.records.insert(position, record)
00341                 record.parent = self.parent
00342                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordChanged)
00343                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00344                 return record
00345 
00346         ## @brief Creates a new record of the same type of the records in the group.
00347         #
00348         # If 'default' is true, the record is filled in with default values. 
00349         # 'domain' and 'context' are only used if default is true.
00350         def create(self, default=True, position=-1, domain=None, context=None):
00351                 if domain is None:
00352                         domain = []
00353                 if context is None:
00354                         context = {}
00355                 self.ensureUpdated()
00356 
00357                 record = Record(None, self, parent=self.parent, new=True)
00358                 if default:
00359                         ctx=context.copy()
00360                         ctx.update( self.context() )
00361                         record.fillWithDefaults(domain, ctx)
00362                 self.add( record, position )
00363                 if position == -1:
00364                         start = len(self.records) - 1
00365                 else:
00366                         start = position
00367                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), start, start )
00368                 return record
00369 
00370         def disableSignals(self):
00371                 self._signalsEnabled = False
00372 
00373         def enableSignals(self):
00374                 self._signalsEnabled = True
00375         
00376         def recordChanged(self, record):
00377                 if self._signalsEnabled:
00378                         self.emit( SIGNAL('recordChanged(PyQt_PyObject)'), record )
00379 
00380         def recordModified(self, record):
00381                 if self._signalsEnabled:
00382                         self.emit( SIGNAL('modified()') )
00383 
00384         ## @brief Removes a record from the record group but not from the server.
00385         #
00386         # If the record doesn't exist it will ignore it silently.
00387         def removeRecord(self, record):
00388                 idx = self.records.index(record)
00389                 if isinstance( record, Record ):
00390                         id = record.id
00391                 else:
00392                         id = record
00393                 if id:
00394                         # Only store removedRecords if they have a valid Id.
00395                         # Otherwise we don't need them because they don't have 
00396                         # to be removed in the server.
00397                         self.removedRecords.append( id )
00398                 if isinstance( record, Record ):
00399                         if record.parent:
00400                                 record.parent.modified = True
00401                 self.freeRecord( record )
00402                 self.emit( SIGNAL('modified()') )
00403                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsRemoved(int,int)'), idx, idx )
00404 
00405         ## @brief Remove a list of records from the record group but not from the server.
00406         #
00407         # If a record doesn't exist it will ignore it silently.
00408         def removeRecords(self, records):
00409                 firstIdx = -1
00410                 lastIdx = -1
00411                 toRemove = []
00412                 for record in records:
00413                         if not record in records:
00414                                 continue
00415                         idx = self.records.index(record)
00416                         if firstIdx < 0 or idx < firstIdx:
00417                                 firstIdx = idx
00418                         if lastIdx < 0 or idx > lastIdx:
00419                                 lastIdx = idx
00420                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00421                                 id = record.id
00422                         else:
00423                                 id = record
00424                         if id:
00425                                 # Only store removedRecords if they have a valid Id.
00426                                 # Otherwise we don't need them because they don't have 
00427                                 # to be removed in the server.
00428                                 self.removedRecords.append( id )
00429                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00430                                 if record.parent:
00431                                         record.parent.modified = True
00432                         self.freeRecord( record )
00433                 self.emit( SIGNAL('modified()') )
00434                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsRemoved(int,int)'), firstIdx, lastIdx )
00435 
00436         ## @brief Removes a record from the record group but not from the server.
00437         #
00438         # If the record doesn't exist it will ignore it silently.
00439         def remove(self, record):
00440                 if isinstance(record, list):
00441                         self.removeRecords( record )
00442                 else:
00443                         self.removeRecord( record )     
00444 
00445         def binaryFieldNames(self):
00446                 return [x[:-5] for x in self.fieldObjects.keys() if x.endswith('.size')]
00447 
00448         def allFieldNames(self):
00449                 return [x for x in self.fieldObjects.keys() if not x.endswith('.size')]
00450 
00451         ## @brief Adds the specified fields to the record group
00452         #
00453         # Note that it updates 'fields' and 'fieldObjects' in the group.
00454         # 'fields' is a dict of dicts as typically returned by 
00455         # the server.
00456         def addFields(self, fields):
00457                 to_add = []
00458                 for f in fields.keys():
00459                         if not f in self.fields:
00460                                 self.fields[f] = fields[f]
00461                                 self.fields[f]['name'] = f
00462                                 to_add.append(f)
00463                         else:
00464                                 self.fields[f].update(fields[f])
00465                 self.loadFieldObjects(to_add)
00466                 return to_add
00467 
00468 
00469         ## @brief Ensures all records in the group are loaded.
00470         def ensureAllLoaded(self):
00471                 ids = self.unloadedIds()
00472                 c = Rpc.session.context.copy()
00473                 c.update( self.context() )
00474                 c['bin_size'] = True
00475                 values = self.rpc.read( ids, self.fields.keys(), c )
00476                 if values:
00477                         for v in values:
00478                                 #self.recordById( v['id'] ).set(v, signal=False)
00479                                 r = self.recordById( v['id'] )
00480                                 r.set(v, signal=False)
00481 
00482         ## @brief Returns the list of ids that have not been loaded yet. The list
00483         # won't include new records as those have id 0 or None.
00484         def unloadedIds(self):
00485                 ids = []
00486                 for x in self.records:
00487                         if isinstance(x, Record):
00488                                 if x.id and not x._loaded:
00489                                         ids.append( x.id )
00490                         elif x:
00491                                 ids.append( x )
00492                 return ids
00493 
00494         ## @brief Returns the list of loaded records. The list won't include new records.
00495         def loadedRecords(self):
00496                 records = []
00497                 for x in self.records:
00498                         if isinstance(x, Record):
00499                                 if x.id and x._loaded:
00500                                         records.append( x )
00501                 return records
00502 
00503         ## @brief Returns a list with all ids.
00504         def ids(self):
00505                 ids = []
00506                 for x in self.records:
00507                         if isinstance(x, Record):
00508                                 ids.append( x.id )
00509                         else:
00510                                 ids.append( x )
00511                 return ids
00512 
00513         ## @brief Returns a list with all new records.
00514         def newRecords(self):
00515                 records = []
00516                 for x in self.records:
00517                         if not isinstance(x, Record):
00518                                 continue
00519                         if x.id:
00520                                 continue
00521                         records.append( x )
00522                 return records
00523 
00524         ## @brief Returns the number of records in this group.
00525         def count(self):
00526                 self.ensureUpdated()
00527                 return len(self.records)
00528 
00529         def __iter__(self):
00530                 self.ensureUpdated()
00531                 self.ensureAllLoaded()
00532                 return iter(self.records)
00533 
00534         ## @brief Returns the record with id 'id'. You can use [] instead.
00535         # Note that it will check if the record is loaded and load it if not.
00536         def modelById(self, id):
00537                 record = self.recordById( id )
00538                 if not record:
00539                         return None
00540                 self.ensureModelLoaded( record )
00541                 return record
00542         __getitem__ = modelById
00543 
00544         ## @brief Returns the record at the specified row number.
00545         def modelByIndex(self, row):
00546                 record = self.recordByIndex( row )
00547                 self.ensureModelLoaded(record)
00548                 return record
00549 
00550         ## @brief Returns the row number of the given record. Note that
00551         # the record must be in the group. Otherwise an exception is risen.
00552         def indexOfRecord(self, record):
00553                 return self.records.index(record)
00554                 
00555         ## @brief Returns the row number of the given id.
00556         # If the id doesn't exist it returns -1.
00557         def indexOfId(self, id):
00558                 i = 0
00559                 for record in self.records:
00560                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00561                                 if record.id == id:
00562                                         return i
00563                         elif record == id:
00564                                 return i
00565                         i += 1
00566                 return -1
00567 
00568         ## @brief Returns True if the given record exists in the group.
00569         def recordExists(self, record):
00570                 return record in self.records
00571 
00572         ## @brief Returns the record with id 'id'. You can use [] instead.
00573         # Note that it will return the record but won't try to load it.
00574         def recordById(self, id):
00575                 for record in self.records:
00576                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00577                                 if record.id == id:
00578                                         return record
00579                         elif record == id:
00580                                 idx = self.records.index( id )
00581                                 record = Record(id, self, parent=self.parent)
00582                                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00583                                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00584                                 self.records[idx] = record 
00585                                 return record
00586 
00587         ## @brief Returns a Record object for the given row.
00588         def recordByIndex(self, row):
00589                 record = self.records[row]
00590                 if isinstance( record, Record ):
00591                         return record
00592                 else:
00593                         record = Record(record, self, parent=self.parent)
00594                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00595                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00596                         self.records[row] = record
00597                         return record
00598         
00599         ## @brief Returns True if the RecordGroup handles information of a wizard.
00600         def isWizard(self):
00601                 return self.resource.startswith('wizard.')
00602 
00603         ## @brief Checks whether the specified record is fully loaded and loads
00604         # it if necessary.
00605         def ensureModelLoaded(self, record):
00606                 self.ensureUpdated()
00607                 # Do not try to load if record is new.
00608                 if not record.id:
00609                         record.createMissingFields()
00610                         return
00611                 if record.isFullyLoaded():
00612                         return
00613 
00614                 c = Rpc.session.context.copy()
00615                 c.update( self.context() )
00616                 ids = self.ids()
00617                 pos = ids.index(record.id) / self.limit
00618 
00619                 queryIds = ids[pos * self.limit: pos * self.limit + self.limit]
00620                 if None in queryIds:
00621                         queryIds.remove( None )
00622 
00623                 missingFields = record.missingFields()
00624 
00625                 self.disableSignals()
00626                 c['bin_size'] = True
00627                 values = self.rpc.read(queryIds, missingFields, c)
00628                 if values:
00629                         for v in values:
00630                                 id = v['id']
00631                                 if 'id' not in missingFields:
00632                                         del v['id']
00633                                 self.recordById(id).set(v, signal=False)
00634                 self.enableSignals()
00635                 # TODO: Take a look if we need to set default values for new records!
00636                 ## Set defaults
00637                 #if len(new) and len(to_add):
00638                         #values = self.rpc.default_get( to_add, self.context() )
00639                         #for t in to_add:
00640                                 #if t not in values:
00641                                         #values[t] = False
00642                         #for mod in new:
00643                                 #mod.setDefaults(values)
00644 
00645         ## @brief Allows setting the domain for this group of records.
00646         def setDomain(self, value):
00647                 if value == None:
00648                         self._domain = []
00649                 else:
00650                         self._domain = value
00651                 self._allowRecordLoading  = True
00652                 self.updated = False
00653         
00654         ## @brief Returns the current domain.
00655         def domain(self):
00656                 return self._domain
00657 
00658         ## @brief Allows setting a filter for this group of records.
00659         #
00660         # The filter is conatenated to the domain to further restrict the records of
00661         # the group.
00662         def setFilter(self, value):
00663                 if value == None:
00664                         self._filter = []
00665                 else:
00666                         self._filter = value
00667                 self._allowRecordLoading  = True
00668                 self.updated = False
00669         
00670         ## @brief Returns the current filter.
00671         def filter(self):
00672                 return self._filter
00673 
00674         ## @brief Enables or disables record loading. Sometimes it's desired that the record
00675         # won't load anything, as otherwise it would load records, by default.
00676         #
00677         # Calling setFilter() or setDomain() after this function will reallow record loading
00678         # if it's disallowed. If the following sequence happens:
00679         #
00680         # setAllowRecordLoading( False )
00681         # sort( 'name', Qt.Descending )
00682         # setAllowRecordLoading( True )
00683         # 
00684         # When setAllowRecordLoading( True ) is called, the record will be updated with the
00685         # latest sort parameters. That is, sorted by name in descending order.
00686         def setAllowRecordLoading(self, value):
00687                 self._allowRecordLoading  = value
00688                 if not value:
00689                         self.clear()
00690                 else:
00691                         self.update()
00692         
00693         ## @brief Returns whether record loading is enabled or not.
00694         def allowRecordLoading(self):
00695                 return self._allowRecordLoading 
00696 
00697         ## @brief Reload the record group with current selected sort field, order, domain and filter
00698         def update(self):
00699                 # Update context from Rpc.session.context as language
00700                 # (or other settings) might have changed.
00701                 self._context.update(Rpc.session.context)
00702                 self.rpc = RpcProxy(self.resource)
00703                 ## Make it reload again
00704                 self.updated = False
00705                 self.sort( self.toBeSortedField, self.toBeSortedOrder )
00706 
00707         ## @brief Ensures the group is updated.
00708         def ensureUpdated(self):
00709                 if not self._allowRecordLoading:
00710                         return
00711                 if self.updated:
00712                         return
00713                 self.update()
00714 
00715         ## @brief Sorts the group by the given field name.
00716         def sort(self, field, order):
00717                 self.toBeSortedField = field
00718                 self.toBeSortedOrder = order
00719                 if not self._allowRecordLoading:
00720                         return
00721                 if self._sortMode == self.SortAllItems:
00722                         self.sortAll( field, order )
00723                 else:
00724                         self.sortVisible( field, order )
00725 
00726         # Sorts the records in the group using ALL records in the database
00727         def sortAll(self, field, order):
00728                 if self.updated and field == self.sortedField and order == self.sortedOrder:
00729                         return
00730 
00731                 # Check there're no new or modified fields. If there are
00732                 # we won't sort as it means reloading data from the server
00733                 # and we'd loose current changes.
00734                 if self.isModified():
00735                         self.emit( SIGNAL("sorting"), self.SortingNotPossibleModified )
00736                         return
00737 
00738                 oldSortedField = self.sortedField
00739 
00740                 # We set this fields in the very beggining in case some signals are cought
00741                 # and retry to sort again which would cause an infinite recursion.
00742                 self.sortedField = field
00743                 self.sortedOrder = order
00744                 self.updated = True
00745 
00746                 sorted = False
00747                 sortingResult = self.SortingPossible
00748 
00749                 if not field in self.fields.keys():
00750                         # If the field doesn't exist use default sorting. Usually this will
00751                         # happen when we update and haven't selected a field to sort by.
00752                         ids = self.rpc.search( self._domain + self._filter, 0, False, False, self._context )
00753                 else:
00754                         type = self.fields[field]['type']
00755                         if type == 'one2many' or type == 'many2many':
00756                                 # We're not able to sort 2many fields
00757                                 sortingResult = self.SortingNotPossible
00758                         elif type == 'many2one':
00759                                 #orderby = '"%s"' % field 
00760                                 orderby = '%s' % field
00761                                 if order == Qt.AscendingOrder:
00762                                         orderby += " ASC"
00763                                 else:
00764                                         orderby += " DESC"
00765                                 try:
00766                                         ids = Rpc.session.call('/koo', 'search', self.resource, self._domain + self._filter, 0, 0, orderby, self._context )
00767                                         sortingResult = self.SortingPossible
00768                                         sorted = True
00769                                 except:
00770                                         sortingResult = self.SortingOnlyGroups
00771 
00772                         # We check whether the field is stored or not. In case the server 
00773                         # is not _ready_ we consider it's stored and we'll catch the exception
00774                         # later.
00775                         stored = self.fields[field].get('stored',True)
00776                         if not stored:
00777                                 sortingResult = self.SortingNotPossible
00778 
00779                         if not sorted and sortingResult != self.SortingNotPossible:
00780                                 # A lot of the work done here should be done on the server by core OpenERP
00781                                 # functions. This means this runs slower than it should due to network and
00782                                 # serialization latency. Even more, we lack some information to make it 
00783                                 # work well.
00784 
00785                                 # Ensure the field is quoted, otherwise fields such as 'to' can't be sorted
00786                                 # and return an exception.
00787                                 #orderby = '"%s"' % field 
00788                                 orderby = '%s' % field
00789                                 if order == Qt.AscendingOrder:
00790                                         orderby += " ASC"
00791                                 else:
00792                                         orderby += " DESC"
00793 
00794                                 try:
00795                                         # Use call to catch exceptions
00796                                         ids = Rpc.session.call('/object', 'execute', self.resource, 'search', self._domain + self._filter, 0, 0, orderby, self._context )
00797                                 except:
00798                                         # In functional fields not stored in the database this will
00799                                         # cause an exception :(
00800                                         sortingResult = self.SortingNotPossible
00801 
00802                 if sortingResult != self.SortingNotPossible:
00803                         self.clear()
00804                         # The load function will be in charge of loading and sorting elements
00805                         self.load( ids )
00806                 elif oldSortedField == self.sortedField or not self.ids():
00807                         # If last sorted field was the same as the current one, possibly only filter crierias have changed
00808                         # so we might need to reload in this case. 
00809                         # If sorting is not possible, but no data was loaded yet, we load by model default field and order.
00810                         # Otherwise, a view might not load any data.
00811                         ids = self.rpc.search(self._domain + self._filter, 0, 0, False, self._context )
00812                         self.clear()
00813                         # The load function will be in charge of loading and sorting elements
00814                         self.load( ids )
00815 
00816                 self.emit( SIGNAL("sorting"), sortingResult )
00817 
00818         # Sorts the records of the group taking into account only loaded fields.
00819         def sortVisible(self, field, order):
00820                 if self.updated and field == self.sortedField and order == self.sortedOrder:
00821                         return
00822 
00823                 if not self.updated:
00824                         ids = self.rpc.search( self._domain + self._filter, 0, self.limit, False, self._context )
00825                         self.clear()
00826                         self.load( ids )
00827                 
00828                 if not field in self.fields:
00829                         return
00830 
00831                 self.ensureAllLoaded()
00832 
00833                 if field != self.sortedField:
00834                         # Sort only if last sorted field was different than current
00835 
00836                         # We need this function here as we use the 'field' variable
00837                         def ignoreCase(record):
00838                                 v = record.value(field)
00839                                 if isinstance(v, unicode) or isinstance(v, str):
00840                                         return v.lower()
00841                                 else:
00842                                         return v
00843 
00844                         type = self.fields[field]['type']
00845                         if type == 'one2many' or type == 'many2many':
00846                                 self.records.sort( key=lambda x: len(x.value(field).group) )
00847                         else:
00848                                 self.records.sort( key=ignoreCase )
00849                         if order == Qt.DescendingOrder:
00850                                 self.records.reverse()
00851                 else:
00852                         # If we're only reversing the order, then reverse simply reverse
00853                         if order != self.sortedOrder:
00854                                 self.records.reverse()
00855 
00856                 self.sortedField = field
00857                 self.sortedOrder = order
00858                 self.updated = True
00859 
00860                 # Emit recordsInserted() to ensure KooModel is updated.
00861                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), 0, len(self.records)-1 )
00862 
00863                 self.emit( SIGNAL("sorting"), self.SortingPossible )
00864                 
00865         ## @brief Removes all new records and marks all modified ones as not loaded.
00866         def cancel(self):
00867                 for record in self.records[:]:
00868                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00869                                 if not record.id:
00870                                         self.freeRecord( record )
00871                                 elif record.isModified():
00872                                         record.cancel()
00873                         else:
00874                                 if not record:
00875                                         self.freeRecord( record )
00876 
00877         ## @brief Removes a record from the list (but not the record from the database).
00878         #
00879         # This function is used to take care signals are disconnected.
00880         def freeRecord(self, record):
00881                 self.records.remove( record )
00882                 if isinstance(record, Record):
00883                         self.disconnect( record, SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00884                         self.disconnect( record, SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordModified )
00885 
00886         ## @brief Returns True if any of the records in the group has been modified.
00887         def isModified(self):
00888                 for record in self.records:
00889                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00890                                 if record.isModified():
00891                                         return True
00892                 return False
00893 
00894         ## @brief Returns True if the given record has been modified.
00895         def isRecordModified(self, id):
00896                 for record in self.records:
00897                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00898                                 if record.id == id:
00899                                         return record.isModified()
00900                         elif record == id:
00901                                 return False
00902                 return False    
00903 
00904         ## @brief Returns True if the given field is required in the RecordGroup, otherwise returns False.
00905         # Note that this is a flag for the whole group, but each record could have different values depending
00906         # on its state.
00907         def isFieldRequired(self, fieldName):
00908                 required = self.fields[ fieldName ].get('required', False)
00909                 if isinstance(required, bool):
00910                         return required
00911                 if isinstance(required, str) or isinstance(required, unicode):
00912                         if required.lower() == 'true':
00913                                 return True
00914                         if required.lower() == 'false':
00915                                 return False
00916                 return bool(int(required))
00917
